q: On which river is Jamshedpur located?
desc: Jamshedpur is an industrial town located on the Subarnarekha river.

q: Delhi is situated on which river?
desc: Delhi, the capital of India, is located on the banks of the Yamuna river.

q: Which river flows through Kanpur?
desc: Kanpur is an important industrial city on the banks of the Ganga river.

q: Surat is located on which river?
desc: Surat, a major city in Gujarat, lies on the Tapti river.

q: Ferozpur is situated on which river?
desc: Ferozpur is a town on the banks of the Sutlej river.

q: Which town is at the confluence of the Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati rivers?
desc: Prayagraj (Allahabad) is famous for the confluence (Triveni Sangam) of Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati.

q: Varanasi is located on which river?
desc: Varanasi, a holy city, is situated on the banks of the Ganga river.

q: Haridwar is situated on which river?
desc: Haridwar is a pilgrimage city on the Ganga river.

q: On which river is Badrinath located?
desc: Badrinath, a famous pilgrimage site, is on the Alaknanda river.

q: Ludhiana is found on the banks of which river?
desc: Ludhiana, a major industrial city, is situated on the Sutlej river.

q: Srinagar is located on which river?
desc: Srinagar, the summer capital of Jammu and Kashmir, is on the Jhelum river.

q: Ayodhya is situated on which river?
desc: Ayodhya, a historic city, is located on the Saryu river.

q: Ahmedabad is found on the banks of which river?
desc: Ahmedabad, a major city in Gujarat, is on the Sabarmati river.

q: Patna is situated on which river?
desc: Patna, the capital of Bihar, is on the Ganga river.

q: Kota city is located on which river?
desc: Kota, known for its educational institutions, is on the Chambal river.

q: Jabalpur is located on which river?
desc: Jabalpur, a city in Madhya Pradesh, is on the Narmada river.

q: Panji is situated on which river?
desc: Panji (Panaji), the capital of Goa, is on the Mandavi river.

q: Ujjain is located on which river?
desc: Ujjain, an ancient city, is situated on the Kshipra river.

q: Guwahati is found on the banks of which river?
desc: Guwahati, the largest city in Assam, is on the Brahmaputra river.

q: Kolkata is situated on which river?
desc: Kolkata, a major metropolitan city, is located on the Hooghly river.

q: Cuttack is located on which river?
desc: Cuttack, one of the oldest cities in Odisha, is on the Mahanadi river.

q: Hyderabad is situated on which river?
desc: Hyderabad, a major city in southern India, is located on the Musi river.

q: Nasik is found on the banks of which river?
desc: Nasik is an important city in Maharashtra on the Godavari river.

q: Lucknow is located on which river?
desc: Lucknow, the capital of Uttar Pradesh, lies on the Gomti river.

q: Which city is not on the Ganga river?
desc: Hyderabad is situated on the Musi river, not the Ganga.

q: From where does the Ganges river originate?
desc: The Ganges river originates from the Gangotri Glacier.

q: Which river falls into the Arabian Sea?
desc: The Indus river falls into the Arabian Sea.

q: Where does the Yamuna river originate?
desc: Yamuna river originates from Yamunotri Glacier.

q: The Sutlej river falls into which river?
desc: Sutlej river falls into the Chenab river.

q: Which river originates from Verinag in Kashmir?
desc: Jhelum originates from Verinag in Kashmir.

q: Which of the following rivers falls into the Bay of Bengal?
desc: Godavari river falls into the Bay of Bengal.

q: Where does the Chambal river originate?
desc: Chambal river originates from Singar Chouri Peak, Vindhyan escarpment.

q: Which river falls into the Gulf of Kambhat?
desc: Narmada river falls into the Gulf of Kambhat.

q: Which river originates from the Brahmagiri Range of the Western Ghats?
desc: Cauveri originates from the Brahmagiri Range of Western Ghats.

q: Beas river falls into which river?
desc: Beas river falls into the Sutlej river.

q: Which river originates from Nasik district in Maharashtra?
desc: Godavari originates from Nasik district in Maharashtra.

q: The Kosi river originates from which glacier?
desc: Kosi river originates from near Gosain Dham Peak.

q: Where does the Betwa river fall into?
desc: Betwa river falls into the Yamuna river.

q: From where does the Brahmaputra river originate?
desc: Brahmaputra originates near Mansarovar Lake.

q: The Luni river falls into which body of water?
desc: Luni river falls into the Rann of Kachchh.

q: Which river falls into Fatehabad?
desc: Ghaggar river falls into Fatehabad.

q: The Tapti river originates from which state?
desc: Tapti river originates from Betul district in Madhya Pradesh.

q: Which river falls into the Krishna river?
desc: Tungabhadra falls into the Krishna river.

q: Where does the Son river originate?
desc: Son river originates from Amarkantak.

q: Which river falls into the Gulf of Kachchh?
desc: Sabarmati falls into the Gulf of Kachchh.

q: Which river is formed near Mansarovar Lake and falls into the Chenab?
desc: Sutlej originates from Mansarovar Rakas Lakes and falls into the Chenab.

q: From which hills does the Ravi river originate?
desc: Ravi river originates from Kullu Hills near Rohtang Pass.

q: Where does the Mahanadi river originate?
desc: Mahanadi river originates from Raipur District in Chhattisgarh.

q: Which river falls into the Bay of Bengal and originates in the Western Ghats?
desc: Krishna originates from the Western Ghats and falls into the Bay of Bengal.

q: Which river originates from the Himalayas and falls into Fatehabad?
desc: Ghaggar originates from the Himalayas and falls into Fatehabad.

q: Which river is associated with the Bhakra Nangal Project?
desc: The Bhakra Nangal Project is built on the Sutlej River and serves the states of Punjab, Himachal Pradesh, Haryana, and Rajasthan for power and irrigation.

q: What is the primary purpose of the Damodar Valley Project?
desc: The Damodar Valley Project on the Damodar River aims at power generation, irrigation, and flood control, benefiting Jharkhand, West Bengal, and Bihar.

q: Which state benefits from the Hirakud Project?
desc: The Hirakud Project on the Mahanadi River is designed for irrigation and navigation, benefiting the state of Odisha.

q: What is the purpose of the Tungabhadra Project?
desc: The Tungabhadra Project on the Tungabhadra River supports power generation and irrigation for Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka.

q: Which river is linked to the Nagarjunasagar Project?
desc: The Nagarjunasagar Project on the Krishna River provides power and irrigation to Andhra Pradesh and Telangana.

q: Which states benefit from the Gandak River Project?
desc: The Gandak River Project on the Gandak River is a joint venture for power and irrigation, benefiting India and Nepal.

q: What is the main purpose of the Kosi Project?
desc: The Kosi Project on the Kosi River focuses on flood control, power generation, and irrigation, benefiting Bihar.

q: Which river is associated with the Farakka Project?
desc: The Farakka Project on the Ganga River improves navigation, irrigation, and silt accumulation, benefiting West Bengal.

q: Which states benefit from the Beas Project?
desc: The Beas Project on the Beas River is for irrigation and power, benefiting Punjab and Haryana.

q: What is the purpose of the Indira Gandhi Canal Project?
desc: The Indira Gandhi Canal Project on the Sutlej, Beas, and Ravi rivers is primarily for irrigation in Rajasthan, Punjab, and Haryana.

q: Which river is linked to the Chambal Project?
desc: The Chambal Project on the Chambal River provides power and irrigation to Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan.

q: Which state benefits from the Ukai Project?
desc: The Ukai Project on the Tapti River offers power and irrigation, benefiting the state of Gujarat.

q: What is the purpose of the Tawa Project?
desc: The Tawa Project on the Narmada River is mainly for irrigation in Madhya Pradesh.

q: Which river is associated with the Poochampad Project?
desc: The Poochampad Project on the Godavari River is for irrigation, benefiting Telangana.

q: Which states benefit from the Malaprabha Project?
desc: The Malaprabha Project on the Malaprabha River is for irrigation and navigation, benefiting Karnataka.

q: What is the purpose of the Mahanadi Delta Project?
desc: The Mahanadi Delta Project on the Mahanadi River supports irrigation and navigation in Odisha.

q: Which river is linked to the Idduki Project?
desc: The Idduki Project on the Periyar River generates hydroelectricity, benefiting Kerala.

q: What is the purpose of the Koyna Project?
desc: The Koyna Project on the Koyna stream near Maharashtra generates hydroelectricity.

q: Which states benefit from the Ramganga Project?
desc: The Ramganga Project on the Ramganga stream near Uttar Pradesh provides power and irrigation.

q: What is the purpose of the Matatila Project?
desc: The Matatila Project on the Betwa River serves multipurpose power and irrigation for Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh.

q: Which river is associated with the Tehri Dam Project?
desc: The Tehri Dam Project on the Bhagirathi River generates hydroelectricity, benefiting Uttarakhand.

q: What is the purpose of the Rihand Scheme?
desc: The Rihand Scheme on the Rihand River provides hydroelectricity and irrigation for Uttar Pradesh.

q: Which state benefits from the Kundah Project?
desc: The Kundah Project on the Kundah/Bhavani River generates hydroelectricity and irrigation.

q: Which river is linked to the Rajasthan Canal Project?
desc: The Rajasthan Canal Project (Indira Gandhi Canal) on the Sutlej, Beas, and Ravi rivers is for irrigation.

q: What is the primary purpose of the Tapti Project?
desc: The Tapti Project on the Tapti River provides power and irrigation, benefiting Gujarat.

q: Which states benefit from the Narmada Project?
desc: The Narmada Project on the Narmada River supports irrigation and power generation.

q: What is the purpose of the Godavari Project?
desc: The Godavari Project on the Godavari River is primarily for irrigation in Telangana.

q: Which river is associated with the Kaveri Project?
desc: The Kaveri Project on the Kaveri River supports irrigation and navigation in Karnataka.

q: What is the purpose of the Yamuna Project?
desc: The Yamuna Project on the Yamuna River is for irrigation, benefiting Uttar Pradesh.

q: Which state benefits from the Sabarmati Project?
desc: The Sabarmati Project on the Sabarmati River provides irrigation and power.

q: What is the primary purpose of the Mahi Project?
desc: The Mahi Project on the Mahi River supports power and irrigation in Gujarat and Rajasthan.

q: Which river is linked to the Banas Project?
desc: The Banas Project on the Banas River is for irrigation, benefiting Rajasthan.

q: What is the purpose of the Luni Project?
desc: The Luni Project on the Luni River is primarily for irrigation in Rajasthan.

q: Which states benefit from the Krishna Project?
desc: The Krishna Project on the Krishna River provides power and irrigation.

q: What is the purpose of the Pennar Project?
desc: The Pennar Project on the Pennar River is for irrigation, benefiting Andhra Pradesh.

q: Which river is associated with the Vamsadhara Project?
desc: The Vamsadhara Project on the Vamsadhara River supports irrigation in Andhra Pradesh and Odisha.

q: What is the purpose of the Pranahita Project?
desc: The Pranahita Project on the Pranahita River is for irrigation, benefiting Telangana.

q: Which state benefits from the Bhadra Project?
desc: The Bhadra Project on the Bhadra River provides irrigation and power.

q: What is the primary purpose of the Sharavati Project?
desc: The Sharavati Project on the Sharavati River generates hydroelectricity, benefiting Karnataka.

q: Which river is linked to the Hemavati Project?
desc: The Hemavati Project on the Hemavati River supports irrigation in Karnataka.

q: What is the purpose of the Bhima Project?
desc: The Bhima Project on the Bhima River is for irrigation, benefiting Maharashtra and Karnataka.

q: Which states benefit from the Wardha Project?
desc: The Wardha Project on the Wardha River provides irrigation and power.

q: What is the purpose of the Purna Project?
desc: The Purna Project on the Purna River is for irrigation, benefiting Maharashtra.

q: Which river is associated with the Girna Project?
desc: The Girna Project on the Girna River supports irrigation in Maharashtra.

q: What is the purpose of the Tunga Project?
desc: The Tunga Project on the Tunga River is for irrigation, benefiting Karnataka.

q: Which state benefits from the Bhavani Project?
desc: The Bhavani Project on the Bhavani River provides irrigation and hydroelectricity.

q: What is the primary purpose of the Amaravati Project?
desc: The Amaravati Project on the Amaravati River is for irrigation, benefiting Tamil Nadu.

q: Which river is linked to the Vaigai Project?
desc: The Vaigai Project on the Vaigai River supports irrigation in Tamil Nadu.

q: What is the purpose of the Palar Project?
desc: The Palar Project on the Palar River is for irrigation, benefiting Tamil Nadu.

q: Which state benefits from the Thenpennai Project?
desc: The Thenpennai Project on the Thenpennai River provides irrigation.
